metadata.title: BROAD-SPECTRUM ANTIVIRAL AND CYTOCIDAL ACTIVITY OF CYCLOPENTENYLCYTOSINE, A CARBOCYCLIC NUCLEOSIDE TARGETED AT CTP SYNTHETASE

abstract.original_text: Cyclopentenylcytosine (Ce-Cyd) is a broad-spectrum antiviral agent active against DNA viruses [herpes (cytomegalo), pox (vaccinia)], (+)RNA viruses [ picorna (polio, Coxsackie, rhino), toga (Sindbis, Semliki forest), corona], (-)RNA viruses [orthomyxo (influenza), paramyxo (parainfluenza, measles), arena (Junin, Tacaribe). rhabdo (vesicular stomatitis)] and ('r)RNA viruses (reo).

sentences.segment_text: Cyclopentenylcytosine ( Ce-Cyd ) is a broad-spectrum antiviral agent active against DNA viruses ( herpes ( cytomegalo ) ,
( + ) RNA viruses ( picorna ( polio , Coxsackie , rhino ) ,
rhabdo ( vesicular stomatitis ) ) and ( ` r ) RNA viruses ( reo ) .

abstract.original_text: Ce-Cyd is a more potent antiviral agent than its saturated counterpart. cyclopentylcytosine (carbodine, C-Cyd). Ce-Cyd also has potent cytocidal activity against a number of tumor cell lines. The putative target enzyme for both the antiviral and antitumor action of Ce-Cyd is assumed to be the CTP synthetase that converts UTP to CTP. In keeping with this hypothesis was the finding that the antiviral and cytocidal effects of Ce-Cyd are readily reversed by Cyd and, to a lesser extent, Urd. but not by other nucleosides
